main event: On the evening of July 5, 1959, a reflective silver object was observed appearing to be motionless in the western sky near Albany, Mississippi.
interesting points: The object was described as roundish, silvery, and oblong, close to the diameter of the sun., A thin white trail, about four times the length of the object, was noticed leading away from it., The trail was described as thin and fluffy, unlike a typical vapor trail., The object began to move smoothly and rapidly after about 3 minutes., When viewed through binoculars, the object was seen to lose visibility after disappearing into clouds.
witness description: The witness was an adult male, approximately 15 years old at the time.
